trans-unit.source: Extends design-time behavior for template-based server controls.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner"></xref> class.
Gets the active template editing frame.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner.ActiveTemplateEditingFrame%2A> property is obsolete.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> property to expose or enumerate templates within a designer for template-based controls.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.ITemplateEditingFrame"></xref> that is the currently active template editing frame.
Gets a value indicating whether or not this designer will allow the viewing or editing of templates.
`true` if the designer will allow the viewing or editing of templates; otherwise, `false`.
When overridden in a derived class, creates a template editing frame for the specified verb.
The template editing verb to create a template editing frame for.
The new template editing frame.
Gets a value indicating whether the designer allows data binding.
`true`, if the designer allows data binding; otherwise, `false`.
Opens a particular template frame object for editing in the designer.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner.EnterTemplateMode%2A> method is obsolete.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> property to manipulate templates within a designer for template-based controls.

If already in template mode and editing a different template frame, this method calls <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner.ExitTemplateMode%2A> to save all its templates and close that frame.
The template editing frame object to open in the designer.
Closes the currently active template editing frame after saving any relevant changes.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner.ExitTemplateMode%2A> method is obsolete.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> property to manipulate templates within a designer for template-based controls.
`true` when switching from one template editing frame to another; otherwise `false`.
`true` if this designer is nested (one or more levels) within another control whose designer is also in template editing mode; otherwise `false`.
`true` if templates should be saved on exit; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the cached template editing verbs.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner.GetCachedTemplateEditingVerbs%2A> method is obsolete.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> property to manipulate templates within a designer for template-based controls.
An array of <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateEditingVerb"></xref> objects, if any.
Gets the data item property of the template's container.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner.GetTemplateContainerDataItemProperty%2A> method is obsolete.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup.Templates%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> collection elements to examine template metadata within a designer for template-based controls.
The name of the template.
A string representing the data.
Gets the data source of the template's container.
The name of the template.
The data source of the container of the specified template.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the template's content.
The template editing frame to retrieve the content of.
The name of the template.
`true` if the template's content can be edited; `false` if the content is read-only.
The content of the template.
Gets the template editing verbs available to the designer.
The template editing verbs available to the designer.
Creates a template from the specified text.
The text to retrieve a template from.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.ITemplate"></xref> from the specified text.
Gets the type of the parent of the template property.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner.GetTemplatePropertyParentType%2A> method is obsolete.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup.Templates%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> collection elements to examine template metadata within a designer for template-based controls.
The name of the template to return the type of the parent for.
The type of the object that has the template property.
Gets a string of text that represents the specified template.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.ITemplate"></xref> to convert to text.
A string that represents the specified template.
template is `null`.
Initializes the designer and loads the specified component.
The control element being designed.
Gets a value indicating whether the designer document is in template mode.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner.InTemplateMode%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is obsolete.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.InTemplateMode%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property for equivalent control designer functionality.
A document is in template mode when a template is currently being viewed or edited in the forms designer.
`true` if the designer document is in template mode; otherwise, `false`.
Provides an opportunity to perform additional processing when a behavior is attached to the designer.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner.OnBehaviorAttached%2A> method is obsolete.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerTag.SetAttribute%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerTag.GetAttribute%2A> methods on the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.Tag%2A> property to map properties to styles.
Delegate to handle the component changed event.
This method is called after a property has been changed.
It allows the implementer to perform any post-processing that may be needed after a property change.
The object sending the event.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentChangedEventArgs"></xref> that provides data for the event.
Provides an opportunity to perform additional processing when the parent of this designer is changed.
Provides an opportunity to perform additional processing when the template mode is changed.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerView.ViewEvent> event is raised by the designer host for certain actions on a control in the design surface.
For example, an event is raised when the user enters or exits template editing mode for a control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner> class supplies a default delegate to handle the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerView.ViewEvent> event.

Classes deriving from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner> override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner.OnTemplateModeChanged%2A> method to process events that are raised when the template mode changes for the associated control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner.OnTemplateModeChanged%2A> method allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

The default delegate performs the updates that are required for a template mode change event in the base <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner> class, and then calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner.OnTemplateModeChanged%2A> method.

The base <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner.OnTemplateModeChanged%2A> method in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner> class returns without performing any additional processing for the event.

If a class derives from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner> and overrides the base <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner.OnTemplateModeChanged%2A> method, the default delegate calls the override method in the derived class.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.InTemplateMode%2A> property to determine whether the control designer is in template editing mode currently.
Saves the active template editing frame.
When overridden in a derived class, sets the specified template's content to the specified content.
The template editing frame to provide content for.
The name of the template.
The content to set for the template.
Gets a collection of template groups, each containing a template definition.
A collection of <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup"></xref> elements.
Updates the design-time HTML.
You should call this method to refresh the design-time display if the template frames have been changed without calling methods that update the design-time HTML automatically.
